I use the Techron for a 20-gallon tank since I think mine is 16.x, but they make one for 12 gallons too, so I'd try that.

Not that it will hold mine together, but it still hums along beautifully somehow...unfortunately many of my speakers don't hum or make any sound, but I think I'm beyond caring about them. I'm happy with spotify out of 4-5 speakers.

Using a bottle recommended for 12 gallons on an 11.9 gallon tank. You sure it's OK? I'd feel more confident if you ran this by your parts guy Ben. He was (is) real, right?

Benn is real...the best parts guy in the country...at Morristown BMW in NJ!

That said, I don't need to ask him, I know what you should do. The math. Use a graduated cylinder and don't get fooled by the miniscus...maybe use an eye dropper. Then return the unused portion to the bottle and save it for the next time.

Also, gummi pflege.

(btw, new set below...not horrible. )

One thing we need to realize is the Techron doesn’t burn as well as gas. Why?? It’s a cleaner and not a fuel. What happens is unburned Techron gets passed the piston rings and contaminates the oil. So, fill the car up with top tier gas and a bottle of Techron to clean things up but change the oil and filter after you’ve burned most of the fuel+Techron.

Techron makes 2 products: Fuel Injector Cleaner and Total Fuel System Clean. The latter is the better product to use. It has a higher concentration of the proprietary cleaning agent and works great. I've used in for many years.

Techron Complete Fuel System Cleaner, 20 Ounce: Add a bottle to the tank every 5K miles with an oil change.

Used it for years although I recently switched to Liqui Moly Jectron (just trying something new based on several very positive reviews).

BobC63

· Registered

Joined Jun 7, 2018

·

187 Posts

Here's my 'regimen' that seems to work well:

First, some background... 2003 Cic w/ 133K on it currently. Being a vert, car gets driven around 5 - 7.5K miles / year; a steady 200 mi / week for 3 seasons and then garaged for the winter. (Run a battery tender and I do take the car out once every month or so for 30 minutes to circulate the fluids, etc/

Run Mobil 1 (yeah, I know, lost it's LL-01 certification but I don't care, LOL) and change the oil and filter once a year. Change the airbox filter yearly as well.

Run top-tier mid-grade gas (Sinclair out by me here in UT) and try to run it down to fairly empty at least once every few tankfuls to minimize build-up in the tank.

Once a year, run the tank down and then a bottle of Techron and 1/2 tank of premium. Run that 1/2 tank out being sure to drive a bit more 'aggressively' (higher revs, heavy on the go pedal, some highway time up around 100 mph steady out in the west desert).

Change the coolant once every 3 years. Plugs / fuel filter every 5 years. Fuel pump was done @ 100K by BMWk

So far (knock wood) zero problems related to fuel system. Idles like a purring kitten, acceleration is crisp and linear. Never stalled out or gotten stuck.

Can't scientifically prove that the Techron helps; but, heck, its $5 a bottle and easy to find (even WalMart carries it).
